resources.string: Choose a UI language from the list
Do you want to revert to the original image?
Are you sure you want to quit?
Please create and then Select a new folder, needed for running the demo.
"Are you sure you want to exit registration? Your registration will not be submitted."
"Registration helps SIL support you and continue SP development."
You have left some fields blank. Continue with submission?
Please provide an database email address
Type a back translation or spell the name.
If this is a Bible story, has this story been checked for accuracy by someone with Bible knowledge?
this is not a Bible story
Please have someone with Bible knowledge check this story for accuracy.

Now it\'s time to install some stories.
Tap the menu in the upper left, then...

To install the demo story, choose:
Add Demo to Story List

If you are connected to the internet, you can get more stories by choosing one of the \'Download ...\' options.
There are no stories in progress.

On the next screen, create a folder and name it SP Templates.
Then tap SELECT at the bottom of that screen.

Here are detailed instructions.

The objective in what follows is to tell Story Producer where to find the story templates.

The next screen allows you to pick a folder.
In that screen you will need to Navigate to the SP Templates folder.
Then tap SELECT at the bottom of that screen.
Message sending is unavailable at this time. Please try again later.
Error occurred, please try sending the audio file again
No Connection: File Queued for Delivery
No Connection: Cannot Retrieve New Messages
No Connection: Registration Queued for Delivery
No Connection: Cannot Retrieve Page Status
Retell the whole story in your language!
Are you sure you want to overwrite your current recording?
No \'%1$s\' audio for this page in the story template.
Page not translated - no narration audio in the local language.
There is currently no WordLinks database installed
Write the story text here if you want the option to include it as a caption on the video.
Write story title to show for all videos made.
Do you want to delete this video?
Using a file manager app, video files can be accessed at:
Please record a translation for each page.
Check your internet connection and please try again.
Messaging service down. Try again later.
The recording was stopped prematurely. Nothing was recorded. Please try again.
Do you want to delete this audio file?
Type Your Local Short Story Title Here
check mark indicating if the local credits have been updated
Type a Short Story Title, above
The file specified already exists. Do you want to replace it?
We are now creating your video. Do not leave this screen until the video is complete.

Language:
Translated by:

Local Credits will be added during voice acting.
This video is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-BY-SA-ShareAlike 4.0 International License ¬©
Make a song for the Bible story! You can choose to include it or not include it when you make a video.
Please wait for SP to scan the templates
Tip:\nIf you are connected to the internet, you can add more stories!\nTap the menu in the upper left, and choose one of the \'Download ...\' actions.

Use the white buttons at the top of the Story List to filter and display types of stories.\nFor example, you can display only Old Testament (OT) or New Testament (NT) stories by selecting the appropriate buttons.\nTap the white buttons to try it out.

Download started\nStay on this page for automatic install
Workspace not accessible, mount the SD card?
Workspace created in app internal storage
Workspace created in app external storage
Workspace created in app private storage
Would you like to move your current projects to this folder? (recommended)
You cannot use this phase until you go back to the Accuracy Check phase and make sure each page is approved by an accuracy checker. |
Your video has been created.\nYou can play it now in the Share Phase.
Generate a 16:9 HD widescreen MP4 output video only.

Use this to specify which language code to use when importing a manually-installed story template / Bloom book (for example, on an SD card). Only this language code will be imported into SP and the book must have content in that language. Normally, leave this blank to import the book‚Äôs default language.
Enter a background color to use for scaled images and videos here as a hex value or color name.
You may turn this on if you will be translating downloaded Bloom Books that do not have any Bible story content. Keep this off if you will be translating Bible story content.
When this feature is enabled‚Ä¶ In the Story List, long press on a story‚Äôs thumbnail to delete that story. Story Deletion cannot be undone.
Hide the practice microphone and toolbar in the Learn Phase.

string.name: settings_experimental
string.font: These settings are experimental. Use with caution!

resources.string: Editing local credits for this story
Now it‚Äôs time to record the final audio in the Drama phase.
The following templates failed to load and are not compatible with Story Producer:
The book has already been downloaded for language \'%s\'.
Do you want to delete the story \"%1$s\" from your device? Deleting this story will delete any audio recordings you have made in this story.
--> Press and hold to back translate

This blue tutorial window gives you step-by-step guidance to complete your first Bible story video.
Tap Next to begin.

You can drag this window out of the way whenever you need to.
Try it now.

You can tap on the blue [?] button anytime to get help for the current screen, or to restart the tutorial.
Right now, tap Next...

Tutorial windows like this will be displayed throughout your first walkthrough of Story Producer.
Perform each instruction before moving on to the next step.

This screen shows a list of the stories currently installed.
Initially, there may be only the included demo story.

When you are ready for more stories, you can download them using the menu.
Right now, the \'000 Storm - demo\' story is good for learning to use Story Producer.
Tap Next‚Ä¶
Tap on a story to begin your translation work.
In this first phase, you will learn the story and practice telling it in your language.

Tap the play button to play the story. Listen as many times as necessary to get it into your mind.
Do it now.
Practice telling the story several times in your language. You do not need to tell all the details, but try to tell a good summary - the main points - of the story.

Tap the microphone and record yourself telling the story in your language.
Stop your recording by tapping the square.

Tap this button to play your recorded story. Listen to it now.
If you want, you may record it again.
When you finish the Learn Phase, tap above and choose the next phase, Record.
In this phase, you will record your translation.
Every story begins with a Title Page, followed by the Story Pages. This label identifies the page.
Choose a title from the list or create your own title. Think about how you would say it in your language.
Tap the pencil now and enter text for your translated story title in your language.

Tap the microphone to record audio for the title.
Tap the square to stop recording.
Now, touch the screen and swipe left to go to Story Page 1.
This is a Story Page. This label identifies the page number.

Listen carefully to the audio for this page. Think about how you could translate it into your language.
Do this now.
When you are ready, tap the microphone to record your translation.

Tap this button to listen to your translation.
You may record it again if you want.
Swipe left to the next page and repeat the Listen, Record, Review process on each Story Page.
When you have finished recording each page, tap above (or swipe up) to go to the next phase, Community.
Now that you have finished recording the story, this Song Page provides a place where you or your community can create a song to accompany the story.
This label identifies the Song Page.

Creating a song can personalize a story and make it more memorable, and language communities are often excited to do it.
So to see what Story Producer can do, just record a few notes now.
Tap the pencil to enter a song title.
Or you could add a photo of the singers or of something in your village.
When you are done on this Song Page, tap above (or swipe up) to go to the next phase, Create.
In this phase, you need to go to the community to get feedback on your translation.
You need to begin on the Title page. If a different page is showing, swipe now left or right until the Title page is showing.

Allow people in your community to play the translation for this page.
Is it meaningful?
Are the words clear and natural?
Ask people to comment to you or to record their comments using the microphone button.
Go to each page and get community feedback.

Use the feedback to improve the translation.
Go back to the Record Phase if you need to revise the translation.
Then return here to the Community Phase to continue getting feedback.
When you are done getting feedback and making revisions, tap above (or swipe up) to move on to the next phase, Accuracy.

In this phase you need to ask another person to check and approve the story for accuracy.
If this is a Bible story, he or she should have Bible knowledge.
The accuracy checker may tap here to review the work that has been done on this page.

Allow the accuracy checker to play the translation for this page now.
Is it accurate?
Do the important words communicate the correct meaning?
Are those words used consistently in the story?

If the accuracy checker feels that a change is best, go back to the Record Phase to make the revisions.
Then return here to the Accuracy Phase to continue checking.
The accuracy checker should tap here if they approve this page. A green checkmark indicates \"approved\".

Go to each page and check for accuracy.
Revise the translation in the Record phase if necessary.

In this phase, you will record the approved translation with a person who has a good storytelling voice. Or, you can dramatize the story by recording it with a team.
Do this in a quiet place.

Listen to the approved translation for this page. Practice saying as much of it as you can. Tap to pause if needed.
Begin now.
Record the translation with a clear voice and dramatic expression.

Listen to your recording now.
If you don't like the recording, record again.

Record audio for each page.
For more information, go to the help menu [?].

Start at the Title page and check the audio volume and quality for each page.
Then swipe left to go to the Song Page.
This pause button allows you to record in smaller phrases.
Tap to hear what you recorded. Try it now.
Tap to resume listening and memorizing the next segment of the translation.
Tap the mic+ button to resume recording.
Or tap the square to stop recording.
In this phase you will add credits and a short title, and choose options for your video.
Tap this button, and fill in information about local participants for this story.
Type a short title in your language, to use as the video filename.
We recommend the options (Fx), (Px), and (Mv) for your first video.
Tap this button to create a video with the options selected.
In this last phase, you will play your video and share it with others.
This screen shows a list of the video files you have created.
The codes, Fx, Px, Mv in the filename represent the options you chose in the Create phase.

3gp is a low quality video for sharing with feature phones.
Use the mp4 file for smartphones and other devices.
Play your video to check it before you share it.
Tap the Share icon and choose a sharing method.
You can also go back to the Create phase to create another video with different options. Like including a song!
When you have finished the work on this story, use the menu to return to the Story List.
Show detailed help for this page
Tap the blue help [?] button in the toolbar to Resume the Tutorial.
No more tutorial pages for this section.
Open a story before selecting this video
